means: （使）摇动， （使）震惊( jolt的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: A stinging slap across the face jolted her.
sentence.Network_cn: 火辣辣的一巴掌打在脸上，她惊呆了。

sentence.Network_en: Henderson was momentarily jolted by the news.
sentence.Network_cn: 亨德森听到这个消息一时目瞪口呆。

PerfectNetExp.abs: While forecasters a gain , its size jolted investors ., 此前预测的收益规模 , 撼动了投资者.
The old bike jolted its passengers badly as it go over the rough road ., 那辆旧车走过崎岖的道路时 , 很厉害地颠簸着它的乘客.
The horse jolted me terribly when he jumped., 马跳跃时 , 我被颠得很厉害.
Stops and starts that jolted the passengers ., 走走停停让乘客颠簸不已.

entry.def: If something jolts or if something jolts it, it moves suddenly and quite violently.

entry.tran: 使震惊；使惊慌；使慌乱不安
entry.def: If something jolts someone, it gives them an unpleasant surprise or shock.

example.ex: A stinging slap across the face jolted her...
example.tran: 火辣辣的一巴掌打在脸上，她惊呆了。

example.ex: Henderson was momentarily jolted by the news.
example.tran: 亨德森听到这个消息一时目瞪口呆。

means.word_mean: 2. disturbed psychologically as if by a physical jolt or shock;

sentences.sentence: "retrieved his named from her jolted memory"

auth_sentence.content: We were once more jolted over the unmade roads.
auth_sentence.res_content: We were once more jolted over the unmade roads.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We were once more jolted over the unmade roads.

auth_sentence.content: The latest policy moves jolted stock markets around the world.
auth_sentence.res_content: The latest policy moves jolted stock markets around the world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The latest policy moves jolted stock markets around the world.

auth_sentence.content: The latest policy moves also jolted stock markets around the world.
auth_sentence.res_content: The latest policy moves also jolted stock markets around the world.
